elements.title: Micah Joseph Lebensohn
elements.contents: ... that Micah Joseph Lebensohn (pictured) began to translate poetry into Hebrew at the age of twelve?

elements.title: Mayflower MRT station
elements.contents: ... that to reflect the neighbourhood's heritage as a songbird-watching community, Singapore's Mayflower MRT station is decorated with 22 bird sculptures?

elements.title: Earl Old Person
elements.contents: ... that Earl Old Person, lifetime honorary Chief of the Blackfeet Nation, inadvertently broke a 1000-year tradition in 1971 when he asked the Shah of Iran to stand up?

elements.title: Dyssodia papposa
elements.contents: ... that the plant Dyssodia papposa was given to horses for coughs by the Dakota and smoked for epilepsy by the Keres?

elements.title: Christiaan Huygens
elements.contents: ... that the first pendulum clock was invented in 1657 by Christiaan Huygens?

elements.title: Kursdorf
elements.contents: ... that Kursdorf is "the loudest village in Germany" and a "sound inferno"?

elements.title: Ed Beauvais
elements.contents: ... that Ed Beauvais co-founded the "darling of deregulation"?

elements.title: right to sit
elements.contents: ... that workers have the right to sit in some jurisdictions?
